channel.title: BBC News - Asia

item.title: Zaki Anwari: Afghan footballer falls to death from US plane in Kabul
item.description: Zaki Anwari, 19, had played for Afghanistan's national youth team before trying to flee the country.

item.title: Ashraf Ghani: Afghanistan's exiled president lands in UAE
item.description: The UAE says it has welcomed the president and his family on humanitarian grounds.

item.title: 'It was very emotional on the plane out of Afghanistan'
item.description: Afghan businesswoman Hassina Syed speaks of her relief at getting out on a British military plane.

item.title: IMF suspends Afghanistan's access to funds
item.description: The move follows the Taliban's takeover, and lack of global agreement over who now governs Afghanistan.

item.title: Nicole Kidman reportedly enters Hong Kong quarantine-free
item.description: Hong Kong media say the Australian star was seen out and about in the city two days after arriving.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: First Covid case detected at Paralympic village
item.description: Japan is battling a record wave of coronavirus infections just five days before the start of the Games.

item.title: Ramappa temple: The Indian shrine that is now a World Heritage site
item.description: The 800-year-old temple in India's southern state of Telangana is now on the tourist map.

item.title: Apple censors engraving service, report claims
item.description: Apple restricts the engraving of political phrases in China, Hong Kong and Taiwan, a report alleges.

item.title: India's living dead: 'They stared at me like I was a ghost'
item.description: If you're dead you can't own land - so if someone obtains your death certificate you could lose everything.

item.title: Afghanistan: The Taliban's victory will test India, and peace in South Asia
item.description: How India engages with the Taliban after Afhraf Ghani left Afghanistan could determine the region's fate.

item.title: Covishield: WHO flags fake jabs in India, Africa
item.description: The health body says it has found counterfeit versions of the Indian-made Covishield vaccine.

item.title: Sunanda Pushkar case: Shashi Tharoor cleared of wife's murder
item.description: Police had charged Shashi Tharoor of aiding his wife Sunanda Pushkar's suicide in 2014.

item.title: What is Sharia law? What does it mean for women in Afghanistan?
item.description: The Taliban say they will govern Afghanistan according to Sharia, or Islamic law

item.title: Uncertain times ahead for Afghan women
item.description: After the Taliban takeover, it is not yet clear how women will fare with the militants in power.

item.title: Afghanistan: Will it become haven for terror with the Taliban in power?
item.description: The Taliban are back, 20 years after being ousted for supporting terror groups. Will they do the same?

item.title: There and back again: The epic adventures of China's wandering elephants
item.description: After a mammoth journey across the country the pack of pachyderms are finally heading home.

item.title: Afghanistan: Journalist Anisa Shaheed refuses to give in to Taliban
item.description: Anisa Shaheed fears women's freedoms will be curbed again if the Taliban come to power.

item.title: Sri Lankan teenager builds solar-powered tuk-tuk from scraps
item.description: Piranawan, 15, from Sri Lanka spent eight months of his Covid lockdown making his eco-friendly vehicle.

item.title: Will the Taliban take Afghanistan back to the past?
item.description: What sort of nation will Afghanistan be after 2021, asks the BBC's world affairs editor John Simpson.

item.title: Why is the Taliban's Kabul victory being compared to the fall of Saigon?
item.description: Many have drawn parallels with America's withdrawal from Vietnam in 1975 - but is this fair?

item.title: Kiwi Chow: The film-maker who took Hong Kong's protests to Cannes
item.description: Kiwi Chow's documentary was a surprise at the film festival - and it has a controversial title.

item.title: Afghans living under Taliban lament loss of freedoms
item.description: Afghans in Taliban-controlled provinces describe life under its fundamentalist Islamist rule.

item.title: Myanmar: The woman who jumped to her death while fleeing police
item.description: Wai Wai Myint was among five people who jumped out of a building while fleeing a police raid in Myanmar.

item.title: Afghanistan war: Do the Taliban want to conquer or compromise?
item.description: The BBC speaks to two high profile figures in its chain of command who have very different messages.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Meet Tokyo's youngest Olympic champion
item.description: Japan's Momiji Nishiya won the first womenâ€™s street skateboarding gold in the sport's Olympic debut.

item.title: 365 dates: Indian serial dater Sunder Ramu still looking to meet his target
item.description: Tamil actor Sunder Ramu's dates are not all romantic ones - and his aim is not just to find love.

item.title: Afghanistan war: Taliban back brutal rule as they strike for power
item.description: Afghanistan's ex-rulers still back brutal punishments, the BBC finds as it goes behind Taliban lines.

item.title: Afghanistan: The people fleeing the north for safety in Kabul
item.description: The Taliban has taken new territories in the north, forcing thousands out of their homes.

item.title: Gurkha veterans on hunger strike outside Downing Street
item.description: Gurkha veterans say they will starve themselves to death if they do not get pensions equal to British soldiers.
